intro: Castilleja organorum, commonly known as the Indian paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant that belongs to the Orobanchaceae family. It is native to the western United States and grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. The plant has striking red, orange, or yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, brush-like inflorescences. Its roots form symbiotic relationships with other plants, drawing nutrients from them. Castilleja organorum plays a role in supporting pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its native environments.
